questions.question_text: You work at a large global holding firm with multiple companies that are united under one Google Workspace deployment. You must ensure that employees can only access documents at the company in which they are employed. What should you do?

choices.D: Set up Google Drive trust rules to prevent access to documents from individual companies.
choices.B: Create an organizational unit (OU) for each company and disable file sharing.
choices.C: Set up data loss prevention (DLP) rules to prevent specific documents from being shared.
choices.A: Create a User group for each company and change Google Drive sharing settings to block external sharing.

discussion.content: D is good

Selected Answer: D
I am ok with D

Selected Answer: D
Not A because you are blocking all external sharing that you may need with, for example, send files to external auditors.
Not B because you wouldn't be able to share neither internally nor externally.
Not C because DLP rules are typically content-specific and not designed to manage access control based on organizational units (OUs) or group structures.
I choose D, although Google Drive trust rules need OUs or groups to define the scope of access control.

Selected Answer: C
https://support.google.com/a/answer/7582554?sjid=15250619034794823950-NA#zippy=%2Cla-calidad-de-v%C3%ADdeo-de-los-usuarios-es-deficiente%2Clos-usuarios-se-desconectan-de-las-reuniones

Selected Answer: A
This allows you to access detailed metrics about the call quality, including network and system performance, which are essential for diagnosing the problem.

Selected Answer: A
I agree with A as "they were unable to resolve the issues by themselves. "
A correct

questions.question_text: An employee at your organization is experiencing video call issues in Google Meet, and they were unable to resolve the issues by themselves. You need to troubleshoot the issue. What should you do first?

choices.C: Restart the device of the employee.
choices.B: Ask your network administrator to add the dedicated Meet IP address range for your users.
choices.A: View the Meet quality report of the employee.
choices.D: Check the Meet settings of the employee.

questions.question_text: Your organization's information security team has asked you to determine and remediate if a user (user1@example.com) has shared any sensitive documents outside of your organization. How would you audit access to documents that the user shared inappropriately?

comments.content: is this the actual exam question and has been updated recently ?

discussion.content:
Answer - A
https://support.google.com/a/answer/11480192?hl=en&ref_topic=11479095#:~:text=View%20files%20shared,Click%20Search.

Selected Answer: A
Option C is not correct lol, read the question again... "HOW would you audit access to documents", for this purpose GW has a feature called Investigation Tool... not everyone knows how to use it but you can for sure get the report, also recently GW updated the Audits and now its merged Audits / Investigation tool so you already have 2 reasons why option A is correct lol, why would you pick option C.. is not asking you to change the external access.. is asking you to Audit.. here is the documentation: https://support.google.com/a/answer/9300435?hl=en

Also I have worked as a GW Admin and Deployment for about 7 years so I know perfectly that the Investigation tool can be used for this.

Selected Answer: A
Drive Logs

Selected Answer: A
A because we do that all of the time haha

Selected Answer: A
A. Open Security Investigation Tool-> Drive Log Events. Add two conditions: Visibility Is External, and Actor Is user1@example.com.
A. Open Security Investigation Tool-> Drive Log Events. Add two conditions: Visibility Is External, and Actor Is user1@example.com.

Selected Answer: A
Letter A, he is asking to investigate and not change settings.

Selected Answer: A
D does not address auditing what the user has shared externally, only to turn off their ability to do so, this cannot be correct.

Answer A

Selected Answer: A
Answer - A
It is A. The option that is exported in answer D doesn't show user names

Selected Answer: C
Answer - C
https://support.google.com/a/answer/60781?hl=en#:~:text=If%20you%20turn%20off%20external%20sharing%2C%20users%20can%E2%80%99t%20share%20the%20following%20items%20with%20external%20users%3A

choices.D: Open Security Dashboard-> File Exposure Report-> Export to Sheet, and filter for user1@example.com.
choices.A: Open Security Investigation Tool-> Drive Log Events. Add two conditions: Visibility Is External, and Actor Is user1@example.com.
choices.B: Have the super administrator use the Security API to audit Drive access.
choices.C: As a super administrator, change the access on externally shared Drive files manually under user1@example.com.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
You might want to use default classification for general, low-risk labels, such as which department created the file, and DLP rules to apply labels used for data protection and retention.

Selected Answer: B
Agree with B

choices.B: Create classification labels, enable automatic classification, and educate users.
choices.D: Integrate with the Cloud DLP API, map identifiers and classifications, install the Google Drive label client, and run the application.
choices.A: Set data loss prevention (DLP) policies to label data automatically, disable label locking, and educate users.
choices.C: Migrate data to Google Workspace, map classifications, and migrate with the Drive Labels API.

questions.question_text: Your organization is migrating to Google Workspace and wants to improve how newly created files are classified. You must find a scalable solution to improve security and transparency on how to handle sensitive files. What should you do?

The Google Analytics service is set to OFF for your entire organization. All users in the marketing team OU and a subset of users in the sales OU need access to Analytics. The rest of the organization should not have access. You must configure access in Additional Google services. What should you do?

choices.D: Enable Google Analytics for the marketing OU. Create a group from the Admin console that includes the sales users, and set Google Analytics to On for that group.
choices.C: Enable Google Analytics for the marketing OU. Create a sub-OU for the sales users under the marketing OU.
choices.A: Enable Google Analytics at the top of the OU structure.
choices.B: Enable Google Analytics for the marketing and sales OUs. Create a group to deny access to Google Analytics and assign it to the sales users who should not have access.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
This is the most efficient solution as it directly targets the users who need access without unnecessary complications.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
